author: nightroman
body:
Any chances to fix this v5 regression in v6?

This command

```powershell
    Get-ChildItem -Path $PSHOME -Include *.exe -Recurse
```

gets expected Microsoft.OneGet.exe, NuGet.exe, pwsh.exe

The same command with `-LiteralPath` instead of `-Path`

```powershell
    Get-ChildItem -LiteralPath $PSHOME -Include *.exe -Recurse
```

in PowerShell v6 and v5 unexpectedly gets all items in `$PSHOME`.

It looks like `PowerShell.exe -Version 2` (in v5) shows the same issue.
As far as I remember, this used to work properly in v4.

****

- UserVoice [v5 regression: Get-ChildItem -LiteralPath -Recurse ignores -Include and gets all items](http://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell/suggestions/11168994-v5-regression-get-childitem-literalpath-recurse)
- Stack Overflow [Powershell 5 Get-ChildItem LiteralPath doesn't work with Include anymore](http://stackoverflow.com/q/33684178/323582)

****

```
PS> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.0-beta.9
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-beta.9
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.10586
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: nightroman
comments.body: NB: It worked as expected in PS v5 Preview. So something changed exactly in v5 Preview -> v5 RTM.

This repros on both windows powershell and core ps.

Get-ChildItem -LiteralPath $PSHOME *.exe -Recurse (works)
Get-ChildItem -Path $PSHOME -Include *.exe -Recurse (works)
Get-ChildItem -LiteralPath $PSHOME -Include *.exe -Recurse (NOT working)
